verses.roman:
tām aha bhagavān kārṣṇir
mātas te matir anyathā
mātṛ-bhāvam atikramya
vartase kāminī yathā

synonyms: tām—to her; āha—said; bhagavān—the Lord; kārṣṇiḥ—Pradyumna; mātaḥ—O mother; te—your; matiḥ—attitude; anyathā—otherwise; mātṛ-bhāvam—the mood or affection of a mother; atikramya—overstepping; vartase—you are acting; kāminī—a girlfriend; yathā—like.
translation: Lord Pradyumna told her, "O mother, your attitude has changed. You are overstepping the proper feelings of a mother and behaving like a lover."
